<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
i = i + 1;
names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.

Regarding your second question, you can use the POI library to read the Excel file and insert the data into the database. Here's an example code snippet that demonstrates how to read an Excel file and insert the data into a database using POI and JDBC:

1. First, add the POI library to your project's build file.
2. In your servlet, create a BufferedReader to read the Excel file:
```java
BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("path/to/your/excel/file.xlsx"));
```
3. Create a DataSet to hold the data from the Excel file:
```java
DataSet dataSet = new DataSet();
```
4. Loop through the rows in the Excel file and create a DataSet row for each row:
```java
String line;
while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
    DataSet row = dataSet.createRow();
    for (int i = 0; i < line.length(); i++) {
        row.setCellValue(i, line.charAt(i));
    }
}
```
5. Insert the data from the DataSet into the database using JDBC:
```java
String url = "jdbc:mysql://localhost/your_database";
String user = "your_username";
String password = "your_password";
Connection conn = DriverManager.getConnection(url, user, password);
PreparedStatement statement = conn.prepareStatement("INSERT INTO your_table (column1, column2, column3) VALUES (?, ?, ?)");
for (int i = 0; i < dataSet.getRowCount(); i++) {
    statement.setString(1, dataSet.getRow(i).getCellValue(0));
    statement.setString(2, dataSet.getRow(i).getCellValue(1));
    statement.setString(3, dataSet.getRow(i).getCellValue(2));
    statement.addBatch();
}
statement.executeBatch();
conn.close();
```
Note that you'll need to replace the URL, user, and password with your own database connection details, and modify the SQL statement to match the structure of your database table.
